conclusion: Problem involves shadows cast by objects when a light source moves forward above them.
Need to determine changes in position and size of shadows A, B, C, and D.
Four objects are on a surface with a light source above them casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
Position and size of a shadow depend on the light source's position relative to the object.
When the light source moves, shadow direction changes and size can increase or decrease.
Light source is moving forward above the objects.
Need to determine direction of shadow movement and size change.
Object A is a pie or round item on a plate with shadow directly below.
If light source moves forward, shadow A should move backward.
Light source moving forward means moving away in vertical direction.
Need to determine if light source moves horizontally or both horizontally and vertically.
Light source moves horizontally forward while staying at same height.
As light source moves forward, shadows should get longer due to shallower angle.
Light source directly above objects then moves forward horizontally.
Angle of light changes, shadows extend farther opposite to light source's movement.
If light source moves forward, shadows move backward and get longer.
